item.description: @Farzad_MD a) Making an assumption about starting point (you didn't tell us that) b) Looks like about 107 miles c) So there is a circle d) Umm .. Charlottesville? https://t.co/U6VPyUty4J
@SavageLucia @aneeshchopra @lisabari The three of us need to up our game .. that's all ...
@SavageLucia @aneeshchopra @lisabari For the record, as always, @aneeshchopra wins for his "half a loaf" quote.
@boltyboy @N_Brennan @ClarityHealth Still with evil side-look ... he hasn't lost the edge ...

@SavageLucia @claudiawilliams Learned long ago by the SUD providers: we can't help an addict until they recognize that they are an addict and they SEEK our help. Alas, health systems = #FFSAddicts. Therefore - nothing changes here. No need to try.

@Farzad_MD @HealthIT_Policy We'll get names later, I suspect ... for now, I just want the "so what" - which is well within the scope of @ONC_HealthIT 's authority. "This is the information we can now share - this is what it means to us."

Once again - the evidence says "no" but (too often) the physicians still say "yes." Why? a) It's easier b) CAHPS and the human need to be liked c) fee-for-service ==> office visit ==> need to leave the visit with something (an Rx) https://t.co/aq9623SBWW

@sacjai Friendly grep -rl : "healthcare" ==> health care (two words emphasizes that health < = > care) ... and "system" ==> "bowl of spaghetti." Systems are intentionally designed. What we have is not - I therefore prefer not to be so generous as my kinder friend, @sacjai. https://t.co/xkOcRsmBWT

@HealthIT_Policy Cousin Steve, it kinda feels like y'all posted the headline and then .. "continued on page 7" but the newspaper ends on page 6! I'll quote my 8th grade English Teacher: "so what?" What's the lesson here? Complaints < > findings. What were the findings? Consequences?
